alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Miller; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lafayette, southwestern Union, southern Miller and Columbia Counties, northwestern Webster, northwestern Caddo, northern Claiborne and northern Bossier Parishes, northeastern Marion, southern Bowie, Titus, Cass, Morris, southeastern Camp and southern Red River Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Pleasant to near Ravanna to near Village. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Magnolia, Atlanta, Springhill, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Vivian, Daingerfield, Haynesville, Linden, Hughes Springs, Lone Star, Queen City, Naples, Cullen, Bogata, Maud and Omaha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
